channel.title: Multiplier on Pascal Michaillat
channel.description: Recent content in Multiplier on Pascal Michaillat

item.title: Unemployment
item.description: This course presents a matching model of unemployment and uses it to study unemployment fluctuations, job rationing, and labor market policies.

item.title: Optimal Public Expenditure with Inefficient Unemployment
item.description: This paper shows that public expenditure should deviate from the Samuelson rule to reduce the unemployment gap, when it exists. Published in REStud, 2018.

item.title: A Theory of Countercyclical Government Multiplier
item.description: This paper develops a New Keynesian model in which the government multiplier doubles when unemployment rises from 5% to 8%. Published in AEJ Macro, 2014.
